basic_info.name: Secret Network
basic_info.description: Privacy-focused Layer-1 blockchain enabling confidential smart contracts using TEE (Trusted Execution Environments)

key_members.name: Alex Zaidelson
key_members.background: Former CEO of Beam blockchain, over two decades of executive leadership in blockchain privacy. Multi-disciplinary Web3 executive with experience in Product Management, VC, BD, R&D. Former Chief Business and Data Officer at VirtuSwap.

key_members.name: Guy Zyskind
key_members.background: Former MIT Media Lab researcher, author of Secret Network whitepapers, one of the most highly-cited authors on blockchain privacy (2,500+ academic citations)

key_members.name: Can Kisagun
key_members.background: Technical co-founder, academic foundation through exploration at MIT

key_members.name: Lisa Loud
key_members.background: Leads ecosystem development and governance initiatives

key_members.name: Tor Bair
key_members.background: Core contributor, sole shareholder of Secret Foundation Inc. Subject of 2023 controversy over $2.625M dividend payment.

encryption_details.why_aes_siv: Nonce-misuse resistant - unlike AES-GCM which catastrophically fails on nonce reuse. Risk of AES-SIV is much lesser than AES-GCM for SGX environment.
encryption_details.state_encryption: Contract state encrypted at rest using consensus-derived keys
encryption_details.io_encryption: User inputs/outputs encrypted via ECDH key exchange with enclave

recent_releases.notes: Critical security upgrade with SGX vulnerability mitigations

known_vulnerabilities.name: xAPIC / AEPIC Leak
known_vulnerabilities.description: Vulnerability in certain Intel SGX chips allowing uninitialized memory reads. Could expose consensus seed (master decryption key).

known_vulnerabilities.name: Wiretap.fail
known_vulnerabilities.description: Academic attack allowing attestation forgery on 3rd Gen Intel Scalable CPUs with physical access

known_vulnerabilities.name: TEE.fail
known_vulnerabilities.description: Extension of wiretap.fail to 4th+ Gen Intel Scalable CPUs (DDR5 vulnerability)
known_vulnerabilities.response: SCRT Labs stated no action required

mitigations_v1_22: Network Access Control - suspended acceptance of new nodes
Trusted Node Allowlist - curated list of verified validators and RPC nodes
Network Seed Rotation - changed consensus seed
security.v1_23_improvements: Semi-permissioned mode - new validators added through governance, Azure nodes can join without limitation

audits.status: No comprehensive public audit reports found
audits.note: Individual contract audits exist but core protocol audit reports not publicly available

2023_controversy.description: Guy Zyskind alleged undisclosed sale of foundation tokens by Tor Bair. Bair claimed funds were owed as part of SCRT vesting schedule.
2023_controversy.outcome: Validator departures, calls for transparency reform
2023_controversy.note: Governance issue, does not affect technical privacy guarantees

major_items: SGX decoupling - ability to run nodes without SGX hardware

secret_ai_sdk.description: Decentralized confidential computing leveraging NVIDIA Confidential Computing with TEE capabilities

research_gaps: Complete security audit reports from third-party auditors
